page.title: 06THE FRUIT FARMER'S DAY
page.content: He gets up at 3:30AM and takes apples to Brighton market. He buys vegetables and imported goods to sell in the Farm Shop. Then he goes to a cafe and has bacon, eggs and tea. When he gets back at 7:30, has a cup of tea and a snack. He empties the van and displays the produce in the shop to be sold by his wife. Sometimes he takes a box of apples to the local school where the children buy them for 2p each. Then he goes to open the 'Pick Your Own' where he weighs the strawberries,raspberries and gooseberries people have picked. He eats his sandwiches when he can. At 7:30pm he comes back to the house and helps clear up. At 8:30pm he has a cooked meal, reads the 'Daily Mirror' and watches T.V.(His favourite programme is news & current affairs.) He goes to bed at about 11.00.
